My School Remembers

Major Project

The Challenge

The final major project of my Diploma was to create software for client, My School Remembers. I, and a team of other students were tasked with developing software that could be used by Year 9 students to create biography slideshows of Australians involved in WWI. The students would use authentic records of historical documents from websites such as The AIF Project, The Australian War Memorial, the National Archives Australia and Trove in order to complete their profiles. The profiles would then be published and available for public viewing. For this project my team was tasked with producing a public view with multiple profiles of ANZACS that could be demonstrated to sponsors, schools and RSL's by Rememberance Day of 2018.

The Solution

In order to achieve this my team put an extensive amount of time focusing on ensuring each profile was fully fleshed out with data gathered from the four aforementioned websites. We also had to ensure the views of each page were dynamic and responsive to different platforms, such as mobile, tablet, or widescreen. The profiles themselves were given the most attention and were completed with a profile picture, basic information, timeline, slideshow, coloured headings to indicate various life stages, and finally a map api with locations set to each slide. When showing our project the client was most impressed with the depth of our research on the subject, while demonstrating the program he spent an extended period of time reading each and every one of our profiles and playing with the functionality.
